text: tens of thousands of Serbians have been
affected by these once-in-a-century
floods and this town just outside the
capital of Belgrade has had it worse
than most the rescue teams here are
working flat-out to get to people this
is where the rescue efforts have been
concentrated in the town of a Brenna
Burton as you can see it's more or less
completely submerged only a few people
remain in their houses here according to
the authorities but they're trying their
best to get help to them nonetheless
although everybody says there would be
much better if they just left the
conditions are appalling three months
worth of rain fell on of renovates in
three days those who have remained have
been without power or fresh water the
emergency services are counting the
holdouts they know they're likely to
find bodies when the waters finally
recede but some would rather stay in
their homes in a Brenna Virts even if
basic supplies are hard to come by the
rescuers would say it's time to leave
and they wish that more would follow
this old man's example the river levels
here dropped slightly over the weekend
but they're likely to rise again as
flood water pours down the river Sava
from neighboring Bosnia the situation
there is at least as bad landslides have
swept away houses and disturbed land
mines leftover from the conflict of the
1990s Croatia has been suffering too the
Sava has flooded in the east and even
falling water levels may not prevent the
river bank collapsing in some places
